p: Soybean flour is produced by grinding raw or roasted soybeans to a fine particle size of 100 mesh or less [ 9]. Soybean flour can be found in full-fat or defatted types. Soybean flour is used in a variety of food products, such as cereals, animal milk replacers, bakery mixes, or beverages, and can be fully, medium, or lightly cooked. Uncooked flour is also used as a bleaching agent in white bread [ 10] and is widely used to raise the protein content in foods, such as bread and pasta [ 11].
